record.title: ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, JULY 24, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, JULY 24, 2007 -- (Senate - July 23, 2007)

[Page: S9793]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 10 a.m., Tuesday, July 24; that on Tuesday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, and the time for the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day; that the Senate then resume consideration of S. 1642, as under a previous order.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I thank all Members for their cooperation today. We got a lot done.
